TopicTitle: Collaborative and Heartwarming Tales from the KSP Modding Community

Articles.Content:
<p>There’s been a few tales of note - a big one and a small one - that have taken place recently in the <em>KSP</em> modding community. They show exactly what the spirit of collaboration and a love for the game is all about.</p>

<p>The first is the opening of <a href="http://bit.ly/1q66GGn"><strong>KERBAL STUFF</strong></a>. Born from a want of a community-built repository, a number of members from throughout the modding community got together and built one from the ground up within a matter of months. From its inception, it’s grown into an alternative to Curse for users who prefer a different and entirely community-driven experience.</p>

<p>The second story belongs to <strong>stupid_chris</strong>, a noted forum moderator and modding community member. He recently underwent some severe computer issues which left it needing a dire fix. Thankfully, the aid of an donor helped bring his plight to a quick end. The donation was made without any prior message or provocation on stupid_chris’ behalf, either. It was yet another case of an unexpected helping hand coming from the modding community.</p>

<p>No matter the situation, we are always proud of how the <em>KSP</em> modding community can get together and continually impress us with the ingenuity they showcase, especially when they come together with their eyes on a prize.</p>

<p>Have any warm community stories you’d like to share? Let us know!</p>

The whackjob computer breakdown comes to mind..... however stupid_chris is more significant, because he is *probably* less well known.....

Mods in general, especially when they become stock, even more emphasis when the dev of them becomes stock (we miss chad and novasiliko )

edit: amazing I wasn't the 10,000nth post !!!!

Edited October 7, 2014 by Nemrav

Aww, who wouldn`t help out Stupid_Chris?

I didn`t know or I could have sent mostly anything. I have about one and a half computers just sitting about most of the time. Power supplies, gfx cards, cases, MB`s a few drives

Usually short of RAM though but who isn`t?
Yargnit. He's a heart warming story of his own XD. Seriously though, the KSP-TV members, moderators, and other well known KSP twitch personnel are fantastic.
Though I'd like to point out it was not just one donnor, there was at least over ten different donnors. That was just plain awesome to see everyone standing up this way to help.

Its a nice thing to recognize another mod repository besides the official one.

And the community here is just simply amazing, cheers to all who helped stupid_cris

Yay for Kerbal Stuff! I'm not against Curse or anything, but it's nice to see a nod towards Kerbal Stuff from SQUAD. I'm sure that will make many people happy.

That's an inspirational story about stupid_chris!

As a newbie modder, I depend heavily upon the modding community to answer my many questions. In one particularly nasty situation concerning solar panels and sun tracking, I provided my Blender file in my OP. raidernick came to the rescue. He corrected my Blender file and returned it. I then asked a bunch of "why" questions so I could understand his reasoning. Thanks to his patience, I now make sun-tracking solar panels with ease and can diagnose my problems when they fail.

I, too, love the modding community. It's great that Squad recognizes its value as well and collaborates to help the modders.
Chris's avatar is better than a sunrise. 'Nuff said.

Chris's avatar is better than a sunrise. 'Nuff said.

Lol, it kind gives me a headache... but I'm glad he's back anyway. I would be lost without RealChute.

Chris's avatar is better than a sunrise. 'Nuff said.

I can't even go on the RealChutes thead anymore because of that damn avatar... I don't know what it is, but it always makes me laugh (to the point of my socks magically flying off sometimes). Maybe it has hallucinogenic properties?
